remarks.format:
## Remarks The SqlDataSourceMode enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource> controls to describe the data retrieval mode that the data source control uses when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method is called. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to DataSet, data is loaded into a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> structure. This enables scenarios where user interface controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> offer sorting and paging capabilities. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to DataReader, data is retrieved by an <xref:System.Data.IDataReader> object, which is a read-only, forward-only cursor.
The SqlDataSourceMode enumeration is only used to describe how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> command retrieves data; it has no effect on other operations the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control performs, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Insert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Update%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Delete%2A>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control to DataReader when retrieving a simple list of items from a SQL Server database into a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
